page.title: 03AN INTRODUCTION TO BAUMBER.
page.content: Baumber has a population of 200 people .It has a main road which runs right through the village and it runs from Skegness to Lincoln.This road is the A158.On the outskirts of Baumber there are two lakes .They were owned by Mr Livesey. the major land ownerfor many years he owned Sturton Hall.Baumber has a rather neglected play area.Baumber also has a public house called THE RED LION.Baumber has not had many houses built for some years now.There is a garage next to the pub owned by Bullwinkles.The pub has a hot meal bar .You can take your food away. Baumber also has a school which has a population of 64.The school has a field.Baumber has a church dedicated to St Swithen the church is made of stone faced with brick.There is a village hall.There is a disused water mill on the River Bain.
